result.markdown:
--- title: 'What Plot?' format: html: df-print: paged --- ## App downloads: Number per day, during a **single week** what type of plot would you choose to visualize the data below? ::: {.cell hash='d1-s1-plot-choices_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_d3d8f3dbb86bce2b404d0ab5fbdd1d56'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
day n
Mon 90
Tue 56
Wed 58
Thu 64
Fri 45
Sat 29
Sun 58
````` ::: ::: ::: {.callout-tip icon="false" collapse="true"} ## What plot? ::: panel-tabset ### Bar ![](../images/what-plot_ndl_bar.png) - Bar plot - good for counts - good for discrete point values - but why not just use a point? ### Point ![](../images/what-plot_ndl_point.png) - Point plot - Conveys *exactly* the same information as the bar plot - However, points might look a bit disconnected - Using points also reduces the need to include 0 on the y axis because there is no longer any possibility of comparing bar areas. ### Lollipop ![](../images/what-plot_ndl_lollipop.png) - Lollipop plot - Conveys *exactly* the same information as the bar plot. - helps reduce the "floatiness" of the points. - Again 0 should be included. - Works well with lots of points. ### Line ![](../images/what-plot_ndl_line.png) - Line plot - Connecting points with a line suggests the points follow a sequence, e.g. day order. ### Pie ![](../images/what-plot_ndl_pie.png) - Pie chart - Eww, yuck! - Too many categories. - Which is bigger: Tue, Wed, Thu, or Sun? - We are pretty decent at noticing deviations from straight / level - but pretty poor at putting a number on the deviation. ::: ::: ## Clients: Age data Here we have many values for each of three categories. The data show the ages of people downloading an app, from three different sectors. Each category has a different number of observations. Decide if we want to see every single observation or summarize in some way. - N observations - Retail: 80\ - Construction: 50\ - Care: 30 ::: {.cell hash='d1-s1-plot-choices_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_0fbb2de1a3653bb999307c99e0725328'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ::: ::: {.callout-tip icon="false" collapse="true"} ## what plot? ::: panel-tabset ### Hist age ![](../images/what-plot_age-by-ind_density.png) - Density plot - Good for visualizing distribution of continuous data - Nice to overlap if only a few categories ### Dotplot ![](../images/what-plot_age-by-ind_dotplot.png) ### Violin plot ![](../images/what-plot_age-by-ind_beeswarm.png) Violin plots convey more info than either bar plots or boxplots, especially if you show points. This plot hints at a compelling story about how users from different industries use the app. ### Average summary bar chart ![](../images/what-plot_age-by-ind_plot_bar-avg.png) - Not a good choice for showing summaries - Too much information lost ### Boxlot ![](../images/what-plot_age-by-ind_boxplot.png) ### Combo plot ![](../images/what-plot_age-by-ind_summary-combo.png) ::: ::: ## Churn: percent-per-year plots ::: {.cell hash='d1-s1-plot-choices_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_b20aebbb378a559a4eecb86580976102'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
year churn (%)
2021 3.2
2022 2.6
````` ::: ::: ::: {.callout-tip icon="false" collapse="true"} ## What plot? ::: panel-tabset ### Bar plot ![](../images/what-plot_churn_bar.png) ### Stacked bars as percent ![](../images/what-plot_churn_bar-stacked.png) ### Pie ![](../images/what-plot_churn_pie.png) What's wrong with this plot? ::: ::: ## Clients: By industry Using the same data as earlier, we want to get a better idea of the breakdown of industry types using our app. Remember, in the full data there are: - N observations - Retail: 80\ - Construction: 50\ - Care: 30 Here's a recap of how it looks ::: {.cell hash='d1-s1-plot-choices_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_c82e851a40def1d7cc8e1a56207a5902'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ::: ::: {.callout-tip icon="false" collapse="true"} ## What plot? ::: panel-tabset ### Bar plot - Count ![](../images/what-plot_age-by-ind_bar-count.png) ### Stacked count ![](../images/what-plot_age-by-ind_bar-stacked.png) ### Stacked percent ![](../images/what-plot_age-by-ind_bar-stacked-pc.png) ### Pie ![](../images/what-plot_age-by-ind_pie.png) ::: :::
